00252 #if !defined(LOW_MEMORY)
00253 struct file_version {
00254    AST_LIST_ENTRY(file_version) list;
00255    const char *file;
00256    char *version;
00257 };
00258 
00259 static AST_LIST_HEAD_STATIC(file_versions, file_version);
00260 
00261 void ast_register_file_version(const char *file, const char *version)
00262 {
00263    struct file_version *new;
00264    char *work;
00265    size_t version_length;
00266 
00267    work = ast_strdupa(version);
00268    work = ast_strip(ast_strip_quoted(work, "$", "$"));
00269    version_length = strlen(work) + 1;
00270    
00271    if (!(new = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*new) + version_length)))
00272       return;
00273 
00274    new->file = file;
00275    new->version = (char *) new + sizeof(*new);
00276    memcpy(new->version, work, version_length);
00277    AST_LIST_LOCK(&file_versions);
00278    AST_LIST_INSERT_HEAD(&file_versions, new, list);
00279    AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&file_versions);
00280 }
00281 
00282 void ast_unregister_file_version(const char *file)
00283 {
00284    struct file_version *find;
00285 
00286    AST_LIST_LOCK(&file_versions);
00287    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_BEGIN(&file_versions, find, list) {
00288       if (!strcasecmp(find->file, file)) {
00289          AST_LIST_REMOVE_CURRENT(&file_versions, list);
00290          break;
00291       }
00292    }
00293    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_END;
00294    AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&file_versions);
00295    if (find)
00296       free(find);
00297 }
00298 
00299 struct thread_list_t {
00300    AST_LIST_ENTRY(thread_list_t) list;
00301    char *name;
00302    pthread_t id;
00303 };
00304 
00305 static AST_LIST_HEAD_STATIC(thread_list, thread_list_t);
00306 
00307 static const char show_threads_help[] =
00308 "Usage: core show threads\n"
00309 "       List threads currently active in the system.\n";
00310 
00311 void ast_register_thread(char *name)
00312 { 
00313    struct thread_list_t *new = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*new));
00314 
00315    if (!new)
00316       return;
00317    new->id = pthread_self();
00318    new->name = name; /* steal the allocated memory for the thread name */
00319    AST_LIST_LOCK(&thread_list);
00320    AST_LIST_INSERT_HEAD(&thread_list, new, list);
00321    AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&thread_list);
00322 }
00323 
00324 void ast_unregister_thread(void *id)
00325 {
00326    struct thread_list_t *x;
00327 
00328    AST_LIST_LOCK(&thread_list);
00329    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_BEGIN(&thread_list, x, list) {
00330       if ((void *) x->id == id) {
00331          AST_LIST_REMOVE_CURRENT(&thread_list, list);
00332          break;
00333       }
00334    }
00335    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_END;
00336    AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&thread_list);
00337    if (x) {
00338       free(x->name);
00339       free(x);
00340    }
00341 }

00343 /*! \brief Give an overview of core settings */
00344 static int handle_show_settings(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
00345 {
00346    char buf[BUFSIZ];
00347    struct tm tm;
00348 
00349    ast_cli(fd, "\nPBX Core settings\n");
00350    ast_cli(fd, "-----------------\n");
00351    ast_cli(fd, "  Version:                     %s\n", "" ASTERISK_VERSION "" );
00352    if (option_maxcalls)
00353       ast_cli(fd, "  Max. calls:                  %d (Current %d)\n", option_maxcalls, ast_active_channels());
00354    else
00355       ast_cli(fd, "  Max. calls:                  Not set\n");
00356    if (option_maxfiles)
00357       ast_cli(fd, "  Max. open file handles:      %d\n", option_maxfiles); 
00358    else
00359       ast_cli(fd, "  Max. open file handles:      Not set\n");
00360    ast_cli(fd, "  Verbosity:                   %d\n", option_verbose);
00361    ast_cli(fd, "  Debug level:                 %d\n", option_debug);
00362    ast_cli(fd, "  Max load avg:                %lf\n", option_maxload);
00363 #if defined(HAVE_SYSINFO)
00364    ast_cli(fd, "  Min Free Memory:             %ld MB\n", option_minmemfree);
00365 #endif
00366    if (localtime_r(&ast_startuptime, &tm)) {
00367       strftime(buf, sizeof(buf), "%H:%M:%S", &tm);
00368       ast_cli(fd, "  Startup time:                %s\n", buf);
00369    }
00370    if (localtime_r(&ast_lastreloadtime, &tm)) {
00371       strftime(buf, sizeof(buf), "%H:%M:%S", &tm);
00372       ast_cli(fd, "  Last reload time:            %s\n", buf);
00373    }
00374    ast_cli(fd, "  System:                      %s/%s built by %s on %s %s\n", ast_build_os, ast_build_kernel, ast_build_user, ast_build_machine, ast_build_date);
00375    ast_cli(fd, "  System name:                 %s\n", ast_config_AST_SYSTEM_NAME);
00376    ast_cli(fd, "  Default language:            %s\n", defaultlanguage);
00377    ast_cli(fd, "  Language prefix:             %s\n", ast_language_is_prefix ? "Enabled" : "Disabled");
00378    ast_cli(fd, "  User name and group:         %s/%s\n", ast_config_AST_RUN_USER, ast_config_AST_RUN_GROUP);
00379    ast_cli(fd, "  Executable includes:         %s\n", ast_test_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_EXEC_INCLUDES) ? "Enabled" : "Disabled");
00380    ast_cli(fd, "  Transcode via SLIN:          %s\n", ast_test_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_TRANSCODE_VIA_SLIN) ? "Enabled" : "Disabled");
00381    ast_cli(fd, "  Internal timing:             %s\n", ast_test_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_INTERNAL_TIMING) ? "Enabled" : "Disabled");
00382    ast_cli(fd, "  Transmit silence during rec: %s\n", ast_test_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_INTERNAL_TIMING) ? "Enabled" : "Disabled");
00383 
00384    ast_cli(fd, "\n* Subsystems\n");
00385    ast_cli(fd, "  -------------\n");
00386    ast_cli(fd, "  Manager (AMI):               %s\n", check_manager_enabled() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled");
00387    ast_cli(fd, "  Web Manager (AMI/HTTP):      %s\n", check_webmanager_enabled() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled");
00388    ast_cli(fd, "  Call data records:           %s\n", check_cdr_enabled() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled");
00389    ast_cli(fd, "  Realtime Architecture (ARA): %s\n", ast_realtime_enabled() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled");
00390 
00391    /*! \todo we could check musiconhold, voicemail, smdi, adsi, queues  */
00392 
00393    ast_cli(fd, "\n* Directories\n");
00394    ast_cli(fd, "  -------------\n");
00395    ast_cli(fd, "  Configuration file:          %s\n", ast_config_AST_CONFIG_FILE);
00396    ast_cli(fd, "  Configuration directory:     %s\n", ast_config_AST_CONFIG_DIR);
00397    ast_cli(fd, "  Module directory:            %s\n", ast_config_AST_MODULE_DIR);
00398    ast_cli(fd, "  Spool directory:             %s\n", ast_config_AST_SPOOL_DIR);
00399    ast_cli(fd, "  Log directory:               %s\n", ast_config_AST_LOG_DIR);
00400    ast_cli(fd, "\n\n");
00401    return 0;
00402 }
00403 
00404 static int handle_show_threads(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
00405 {
00406    int count = 0;
00407    struct thread_list_t *cur;
00408 
00409    AST_LIST_LOCK(&thread_list);
00410    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE(&thread_list, cur, list) {
00411       ast_cli(fd, "%p %s\n", (void *)cur->id, cur->name);
00412       count++;
00413    }
00414         AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&thread_list);
00415    ast_cli(fd, "%d threads listed.\n", count);
00416    return 0;
00417 }

00424 /*! \brief Give an overview of system statistics */
00425 static int handle_show_sysinfo(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
00426 {
00427    struct sysinfo sys_info;
00428 
00429    if (sysinfo(&sys_info)) {
00430       ast_cli(fd, "FAILED to retrieve system information\n\n");
00431       return 0;
00432    }
00433    ast_cli(fd, "\nSystem Statistics\n");
00434    ast_cli(fd, "-----------------\n");
00435    ast_cli(fd, "  System Uptime:             %ld hours\n", sys_info.uptime/3600);
00436    ast_cli(fd, "  Total RAM:                 %ld KiB\n", (sys_info.totalram / sys_info.mem_unit)/1024);
00437    ast_cli(fd, "  Free RAM:                  %ld KiB\n", (sys_info.freeram / sys_info.mem_unit)/1024);
00438    ast_cli(fd, "  Buffer RAM:                %ld KiB\n", (sys_info.bufferram / sys_info.mem_unit)/1024);
00439    ast_cli(fd, "  Total Swap Space:          %ld KiB\n", (sys_info.totalswap / sys_info.mem_unit)/1024);
00440    ast_cli(fd, "  Free Swap Space:           %ld KiB\n\n", (sys_info.freeswap / sys_info.mem_unit)/1024);
00441    ast_cli(fd, "  Number of Processes:       %d \n\n", sys_info.procs);
00442    return 0;
00443 }
00444 #endif
00445 
00446 struct profile_entry {
00447    const char *name;
00448    uint64_t scale;   /* if non-zero, values are scaled by this */
00449    int64_t  mark;
00450    int64_t  value;
00451    int64_t  events;
00452 };
00453 
00454 struct profile_data {
00455    int entries;
00456    int max_size;
00457    struct profile_entry e[0];
00458 };
00459 
00460 static struct profile_data *prof_data;
00461 
00462 /*! \brief allocates a counter with a given name and scale.
00463  * \return Returns the identifier of the counter.
00464  */
00465 int ast_add_profile(const char *name, uint64_t scale)
00466 {
00467    int l = sizeof(struct profile_data);
00468    int n = 10; /* default entries */
00469 
00470    if (prof_data == NULL) {
00471       prof_data = ast_calloc(1, l + n*sizeof(struct profile_entry));
00472       if (prof_data == NULL)
00473          return -1;
00474       prof_data->entries = 0;
00475       prof_data->max_size = n;
00476    }
00477    if (prof_data->entries >= prof_data->max_size) {
00478       void *p;
00479       n = prof_data->max_size + 20;
00480       p = ast_realloc(prof_data, l + n*sizeof(struct profile_entry));
00481       if (p == NULL)
00482          return -1;
00483       prof_data = p;
00484       prof_data->max_size = n;
00485    }
00486    n = prof_data->entries++;
00487    prof_data->e[n].name = ast_strdup(name);
00488    prof_data->e[n].value = 0;
00489    prof_data->e[n].events = 0;
00490    prof_data->e[n].mark = 0;
00491    prof_data->e[n].scale = scale;
00492    return n;
00493 }
00494 
00495 int64_t ast_profile(int i, int64_t delta)
00496 {
00497    if (!prof_data || i < 0 || i > prof_data->entries) /* invalid index */
00498       return 0;
00499    if (prof_data->e[i].scale > 1)
00500       delta /= prof_data->e[i].scale;
00501    prof_data->e[i].value += delta;
00502    prof_data->e[i].events++;
00503    return prof_data->e[i].value;
00504 }
00505 
00506 #if defined ( __i386__) && (defined(__FreeBSD__) || defined(linux))
00507 #if defined(__FreeBSD__)
00508 #include <machine/cpufunc.h>
00509 #elif defined(linux)
00510 static __inline uint64_t
00511 rdtsc(void)
00512 { 
00513    uint64_t rv;
00514 
00515    __asm __volatile(".byte 0x0f, 0x31" : "=A" (rv));
00516    return (rv);
00517 }
00518 #endif
00519 #else /* supply a dummy function on other platforms */
00520 static __inline uint64_t
00521 rdtsc(void)
00522 {
00523    return 0;
00524 }
00525 #endif
00526 
00527 int64_t ast_mark(int i, int startstop)
00528 {
00529    if (!prof_data || i < 0 || i > prof_data->entries) /* invalid index */
00530       return 0;
00531    if (startstop == 1)
00532       prof_data->e[i].mark = rdtsc();
00533    else {
00534       prof_data->e[i].mark = (rdtsc() - prof_data->e[i].mark);
00535       if (prof_data->e[i].scale > 1)
00536          prof_data->e[i].mark /= prof_data->e[i].scale;
00537       prof_data->e[i].value += prof_data->e[i].mark;
00538       prof_data->e[i].events++;
00539    }
00540    return prof_data->e[i].mark;
00541 }
00542 
00543 static int handle_show_profile(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
00544 {
00545    int i, min, max;
00546    char *search = NULL;
00547 
00548    if (prof_data == NULL)
00549       return 0;
00550 
00551    min = 0;
00552    max = prof_data->entries;
00553    if  (argc > 3) { /* specific entries */
00554       if (isdigit(argv[3][0])) {
00555          min = atoi(argv[3]);
00556          if (argc == 5 && strcmp(argv[4], "-"))
00557             max = atoi(argv[4]);
00558       } else
00559          search = argv[3];
00560    }
00561    if (max > prof_data->entries)
00562       max = prof_data->entries;
00563    if (!strcmp(argv[1], "clear")) {
00564       for (i= min; i < max; i++) {
00565          if (!search || strstr(prof_data->e[i].name, search)) {
00566             prof_data->e[i].value = 0;
00567             prof_data->e[i].events = 0;
00568          }
00569       }
00570       return 0;
00571    }
00572    ast_cli(fd, "profile values (%d, allocated %d)\n-------------------\n",
00573       prof_data->entries, prof_data->max_size);
00574    ast_cli(fd, "%6s   %8s  %10s %12s %12s  %s\n", "ID", "Scale", "Events",
00575          "Value", "Average", "Name");
00576    for (i = min; i < max; i++) {
00577       struct profile_entry *e = &prof_data->e[i];
00578       if (!search || strstr(prof_data->e[i].name, search))
00579           ast_cli(fd, "%6d: [%8ld] %10ld %12lld %12lld  %s\n",
00580          i,
00581          (long)e->scale,
00582          (long)e->events, (long long)e->value,
00583          (long long)(e->events ? e->value / e->events : e->value),
00584          e->name);
00585    }
00586    return 0;
00587 }
00588 
00589 static const char show_version_files_help[] = 
00590 "Usage: core show file version [like <pattern>]\n"
00591 "       Lists the revision numbers of the files used to build this copy of Asterisk.\n"
00592 "       Optional regular expression pattern is used to filter the file list.\n";
00593 
00594 /*! \brief CLI command to list module versions */
00595 static int handle_show_version_files(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
00596 {
00597 #define FORMAT "%-25.25s %-40.40s\n"
00598    struct file_version *iterator;
00599    regex_t regexbuf;
00600    int havepattern = 0;
00601    int havename = 0;
00602    int count_files = 0;
00603 
00604    switch (argc) {
00605    case 6:
00606       if (!strcasecmp(argv[4], "like")) {
00607          if (regcomp(&regexbuf, argv[5], REG_EXTENDED | REG_NOSUB))
00608             return RESULT_SHOWUSAGE;
00609          havepattern = 1;
00610       } else
00611          return RESULT_SHOWUSAGE;
00612       break;
00613    case 5:
00614       havename = 1;
00615       break;
00616    case 4:
00617       break;
00618    default:
00619       return RESULT_SHOWUSAGE;
00620    }
00621 
00622    ast_cli(fd, FORMAT, "File", "Revision");
00623    ast_cli(fd, FORMAT, "----", "--------");
00624    AST_LIST_LOCK(&file_versions);
00625    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE(&file_versions, iterator, list) {
00626       if (havename && strcasecmp(iterator->file, argv[4]))
00627          continue;
00628 
00629       if (havepattern && regexec(&regexbuf, iterator->file, 0, NULL, 0))
00630          continue;
00631 
00632       ast_cli(fd, FORMAT, iterator->file, iterator->version);
00633       count_files++;
00634       if (havename)
00635          break;
00636    }
00637    AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&file_versions);
00638    if (!havename) {
00639       ast_cli(fd, "%d files listed.\n", count_files);
00640    }
00641 
00642    if (havepattern)
00643       regfree(&regexbuf);
00644 
00645    return RESULT_SUCCESS;
00646 #undef FORMAT
00647 }
00648 
00649 static char *complete_show_version_files(const char *line, const char *word, int pos, int state)
00650 {
00651    struct file_version *find;
00652    int which = 0;
00653    char *ret = NULL;
00654    int matchlen = strlen(word);
00655 
00656    if (pos != 3)
00657       return NULL;
00658 
00659    AST_LIST_LOCK(&file_versions);
00660    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE(&file_versions, find, list) {
00661       if (!strncasecmp(word, find->file, matchlen) && ++which > state) {
00662          ret = ast_strdup(find->file);
00663          break;
00664       }
00665    }
00666    AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&file_versions);
00667 
00668    return ret;
00669 }
00670 #endif /* ! LOW_MEMORY */
00671 
00672 int ast_register_atexit(void (*func)(void))
00673 {
00674    int res = -1;
00675    struct ast_atexit *ae;
00676    ast_unregister_atexit(func);  
00677    AST_LIST_LOCK(&atexits);
00678    if ((ae = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*ae)))) {
00679       AST_LIST_INSERT_HEAD(&atexits, ae, list);
00680       ae->func = func;
00681       res = 0;
00682    }
00683    AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&atexits);
00684    return res;
00685 }
00686 
00687 void ast_unregister_atexit(void (*func)(void))
00688 {
00689    struct ast_atexit *ae;
00690    AST_LIST_LOCK(&atexits);
00691    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_BEGIN(&atexits, ae, list) {
00692       if (ae->func == func) {
00693          AST_LIST_REMOVE_CURRENT(&atexits, list);
00694          break;
00695       }
00696    }
00697    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_END
00698    AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&atexits);
00699 }
00700 
00701 static int fdprint(int fd, const char *s)
00702 {
00703    return write(fd, s, strlen(s) + 1);
00704 }
00705 
00706 /*! \brief NULL handler so we can collect the child exit status */
00707 static void null_sig_handler(int signal)
00708 {
00709 
00710 }
00711 
00712 AST_MUTEX_DEFINE_STATIC(safe_system_lock);
00713 /*! \brief Keep track of how many threads are currently trying to wait*() on
00714  *  a child process */
00715 static unsigned int safe_system_level = 0;
00716 static void *safe_system_prev_handler;
00717 
00718 void ast_replace_sigchld(void)
00719 {
00720    unsigned int level;
00721 
00722    ast_mutex_lock(&safe_system_lock);
00723    level = safe_system_level++;
00724 
00725    /* only replace the handler if it has not already been done */
00726    if (level == 0)
00727       safe_system_prev_handler = signal(SIGCHLD, null_sig_handler);
00728 
00729    ast_mutex_unlock(&safe_system_lock);
00730 }
00731 
00732 void ast_unreplace_sigchld(void)
00733 {
00734    unsigned int level;
00735 
00736    ast_mutex_lock(&safe_system_lock);
00737    level = --safe_system_level;
00738 
00739    /* only restore the handler if we are the last one */
00740    if (level == 0)
00741       signal(SIGCHLD, safe_system_prev_handler);
00742 
00743    ast_mutex_unlock(&safe_system_lock);
00744 }
00745 
00746 int ast_safe_system(const char *s)
00747 {
00748    pid_t pid;
00749 #ifdef HAVE_WORKING_FORK
00750    int x;
00751 #endif
00752    int res;
00753    struct rusage rusage;
00754    int status;
00755 
00756 #if defined(HAVE_WORKING_FORK) || defined(HAVE_WORKING_VFORK)
00757    ast_replace_sigchld();
00758 
00759 #ifdef HAVE_WORKING_FORK
00760    pid = fork();
00761 #else
00762    pid = vfork();
00763 #endif   
00764 
00765    if (pid == 0) {
00766 #ifdef HAVE_WORKING_FORK
00767       if (ast_opt_high_priority)
00768          ast_set_priority(0);
00769       /* Close file descriptors and launch system command */
00770       for (x = STDERR_FILENO + 1; x < 4096; x++)
00771          close(x);
00772 #endif
00773       execl("/bin/sh", "/bin/sh", "-c", s, (char *) NULL);
00774       _exit(1);
00775    } else if (pid > 0) {
00776       for (;;) {
00777          res = wait4(pid, &status, 0, &rusage);
00778          if (res > -1) {
00779             res = WIFEXITED(status) ? WEXITSTATUS(status) : -1;
00780             break;
00781          } else if (errno != EINTR) 
00782             break;
00783       }
00784    } else {
00785       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Fork failed: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00786       res = -1;
00787    }
00788 
00789    ast_unreplace_sigchld();
00790 #else
00791    res = -1;
00792 #endif
00793 
00794    return res;
00795 }
00796 
00797 /*!
00798  * \brief mute or unmute a console from logging
00799  */
00800 void ast_console_toggle_mute(int fd) {
00801    int x;
00802    for (x = 0;x < AST_MAX_CONNECTS; x++) {
00803       if (fd == consoles[x].fd) {
00804          if (consoles[x].mute) {
00805             consoles[x].mute = 0;
00806             ast_cli(fd, "Console is not muted anymore.\n");
00807          } else {
00808             consoles[x].mute = 1;
00809             ast_cli(fd, "Console is muted.\n");
00810          }
00811          return;
00812       }
00813    }
00814    ast_cli(fd, "Couldn't find remote console.\n");
00815 }
00816 
00817 /*!
00818  * \brief log the string to all attached console clients
00819  */
00820 static void ast_network_puts_mutable(const char *string)
00821 {
00822    int x;
00823    for (x = 0;x < AST_MAX_CONNECTS; x++) {
00824       if (consoles[x].mute)
00825          continue;
00826       if (consoles[x].fd > -1) 
00827          fdprint(consoles[x].p[1], string);
00828    }
00829 }
00830 
00831 /*!
00832  * \brief log the string to the console, and all attached
00833  * console clients
00834  */
00835 void ast_console_puts_mutable(const char *string)
00836 {
00837    fputs(string, stdout);
00838    fflush(stdout);
00839    ast_network_puts_mutable(string);
00840 }
00841 
00842 /*!
00843  * \brief write the string to all attached console clients
00844  */
00845 static void ast_network_puts(const char *string)
00846 {
00847    int x;
00848    for (x=0; x < AST_MAX_CONNECTS; x++) {
00849       if (consoles[x].fd > -1) 
00850          fdprint(consoles[x].p[1], string);
00851    }
00852 }
00853 
00854 /*!
00855  * write the string to the console, and all attached
00856  * console clients
00857  */
00858 void ast_console_puts(const char *string)
00859 {
00860    fputs(string, stdout);
00861    fflush(stdout);
00862    ast_network_puts(string);
00863 }
00864 
00865 static void network_verboser(const char *s)
00866 {
00867    ast_network_puts_mutable(s);
00868 }
00869 
00870 static pthread_t lthread;
00871 
00872 static void *netconsole(void *vconsole)
00873 {
00874    struct console *con = vconsole;
00875    char hostname[MAXHOSTNAMELEN] = "";
00876    char tmp[512];
00877    int res;
00878    struct pollfd fds[2];
00879    
00880    if (gethostname(hostname, sizeof(hostname)-1))
00881       ast_copy_string(hostname, "<Unknown>", sizeof(hostname));
00882    snprintf(tmp, sizeof(tmp), "%s/%ld/%s\n", hostname, (long)ast_mainpid, ASTERISK_VERSION);
00883    fdprint(con->fd, tmp);
00884    for (;;) {
00885       fds[0].fd = con->fd;
00886       fds[0].events = POLLIN;
00887       fds[0].revents = 0;
00888       fds[1].fd = con->p[0];
00889       fds[1].events = POLLIN;
00890       fds[1].revents = 0;
00891 
00892       res = poll(fds, 2, -1);
00893       if (res < 0) {
00894          if (errno != EINTR)
00895             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "poll returned < 0: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00896          continue;
00897       }
00898       if (fds[0].revents) {
00899          res = read(con->fd, tmp, sizeof(tmp));
00900          if (res < 1) {
00901             break;
00902          }
00903          tmp[res] = 0;
00904          ast_cli_command(con->fd, tmp);
00905       }
00906       if (fds[1].revents) {
00907          res = read(con->p[0], tmp, sizeof(tmp));
00908          if (res < 1) {
00909             ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "read returned %d\n", res);
00910             break;
00911          }
00912          res = write(con->fd, tmp, res);
00913          if (res < 1)
00914             break;
00915       }
00916    }
00917    if (option_verbose > 2) 
00918       ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Remote UNIX connection disconnected\n");
00919    close(con->fd);
00920    close(con->p[0]);
00921    close(con->p[1]);
00922    con->fd = -1;
00923    
00924    return NULL;
00925 }
00926 
00927 static void *listener(void *unused)
00928 {
00929    struct sockaddr_un sunaddr;
00930    int s;
00931    socklen_t len;
00932    int x;
00933    int flags;
00934    struct pollfd fds[1];
00935    for (;;) {
00936       if (ast_socket < 0)
00937          return NULL;
00938       fds[0].fd = ast_socket;
00939       fds[0].events = POLLIN;
00940       s = poll(fds, 1, -1);
00941       pthread_testcancel();
00942       if (s < 0) {
00943          if (errno != EINTR)
00944             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "poll returned error: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00945          continue;
00946       }
00947       len = sizeof(sunaddr);
00948       s = accept(ast_socket, (struct sockaddr *)&sunaddr, &len);
00949       if (s < 0) {
00950          if (errno != EINTR)
00951             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Accept returned %d: %s\n", s, strerror(errno));
00952       } else {
00953          for (x = 0; x < AST_MAX_CONNECTS; x++) {
00954             if (consoles[x].fd < 0) {
00955                if (socketpair(AF_LOCAL, SOCK_STREAM, 0, consoles[x].p)) {
00956                   ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Unable to create pipe: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00957                   consoles[x].fd = -1;
00958                   fdprint(s, "Server failed to create pipe\n");
00959                   close(s);
00960                   break;
00961                }
00962                flags = fcntl(consoles[x].p[1], F_GETFL);
00963                fcntl(consoles[x].p[1], F_SETFL, flags | O_NONBLOCK);
00964                consoles[x].fd = s;
00965                consoles[x].mute = ast_opt_mute;
00966                if (ast_pthread_create_detached_background(&consoles[x].t, NULL, netconsole, &consoles[x])) {
00967                   ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Unable to spawn thread to handle connection: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00968                   close(consoles[x].p[0]);
00969                   close(consoles[x].p[1]);
00970                   consoles[x].fd = -1;
00971                   fdprint(s, "Server failed to spawn thread\n");
00972                   close(s);
00973                }
00974                break;
00975             }
00976          }
00977          if (x >= AST_MAX_CONNECTS) {
00978             fdprint(s, "No more connections allowed\n");
00979             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "No more connections allowed\n");
00980             close(s);
00981          } else if (consoles[x].fd > -1) {
00982             if (option_verbose > 2) 
00983                ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Remote UNIX connection\n");
00984          }
00985       }
00986    }
00987    return NULL;
00988 }
00989 
00990 static int ast_makesocket(void)
00991 {
00992    struct sockaddr_un sunaddr;
00993    int res;
00994    int x;
00995    uid_t uid = -1;
00996    gid_t gid = -1;
00997 
00998    for (x = 0; x < AST_MAX_CONNECTS; x++) 
00999       consoles[x].fd = -1;
01000    unlink(ast_config_AST_SOCKET);
01001    ast_socket = socket(PF_LOCAL, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
01002    if (ast_socket < 0) {
01003       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to create control socket: %s\n", strerror(errno));
01004       return -1;
01005    }     
01006    memset(&sunaddr, 0, sizeof(sunaddr));
01007    sunaddr.sun_family = AF_LOCAL;
01008    ast_copy_string(sunaddr.sun_path, ast_config_AST_SOCKET, sizeof(sunaddr.sun_path));
01009    res = bind(ast_socket, (struct sockaddr *)&sunaddr, sizeof(sunaddr));
01010    if (res) {
01011       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to bind socket to %s: %s\n", ast_config_AST_SOCKET, strerror(errno));
01012       close(ast_socket);
01013       ast_socket = -1;
01014       return -1;
01015    }
01016    res = listen(ast_socket, 2);
01017    if (res < 0) {
01018       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to listen on socket %s: %s\n", ast_config_AST_SOCKET, strerror(errno));
01019       close(ast_socket);
01020       ast_socket = -1;
01021       return -1;
01022    }
01023    ast_register_verbose(network_verboser);
01024    ast_pthread_create_background(&lthread, NULL, listener, NULL);
01025 
01026    if (!ast_strlen_zero(ast_config_AST_CTL_OWNER)) {
01027       struct passwd *pw;
01028       if ((pw = getpwnam(ast_config_AST_CTL_OWNER)) == NULL)
01029          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to find uid of user %s\n", ast_config_AST_CTL_OWNER);
01030       else
01031          uid = pw->pw_uid;
01032    }
01033       
01034    if (!ast_strlen_zero(ast_config_AST_CTL_GROUP)) {
01035       struct group *grp;
01036       if ((grp = getgrnam(ast_config_AST_CTL_GROUP)) == NULL)
01037          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to find gid of group %s\n", ast_config_AST_CTL_GROUP);
01038       else
01039          gid = grp->gr_gid;
01040    }
01041 
01042    if (chown(ast_config_AST_SOCKET, uid, gid) < 0)
01043       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to change ownership of %s: %s\n", ast_config_AST_SOCKET, strerror(errno));
01044 
01045    if (!ast_strlen_zero(ast_config_AST_CTL_PERMISSIONS)) {
01046       int p1;
01047       mode_t p;
01048       sscanf(ast_config_AST_CTL_PERMISSIONS, "%o", &p1);
01049       p = p1;
01050       if ((chmod(ast_config_AST_SOCKET, p)) < 0)
01051          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to change file permissions of %s: %s\n", ast_config_AST_SOCKET, strerror(errno));
01052    }
01053 
01054    return 0;
01055 }
01056 
01057 static int ast_tryconnect(void)
01058 {
01059    struct sockaddr_un sunaddr;
01060    int res;
01061    ast_consock = socket(PF_LOCAL, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
01062    if (ast_consock < 0) {
01063       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to create socket: %s\n", strerror(errno));
01064       return 0;
01065    }
01066    memset(&sunaddr, 0, sizeof(sunaddr));
01067    sunaddr.sun_family = AF_LOCAL;
01068    ast_copy_string(sunaddr.sun_path, (char *)ast_config_AST_SOCKET, sizeof(sunaddr.sun_path));
01069    res = connect(ast_consock, (struct sockaddr *)&sunaddr, sizeof(sunaddr));
01070    if (res) {
01071       close(ast_consock);
01072       ast_consock = -1;
01073       return 0;
01074    } else
01075       return 1;
01076 }
01077 
01078 /*! \brief Urgent handler
01079 
01080  Called by soft_hangup to interrupt the poll, read, or other
01081  system call.  We don't actually need to do anything though.  
01082  Remember: Cannot EVER ast_log from within a signal handler 
01083  */
01084 static void urg_handler(int num)
01085 {
01086    signal(num, urg_handler);
01087    return;
01088 }
01089 
01090 static void hup_handler(int num)
01091 {
01092    int a = 0;
01093    if (option_verbose > 1) 
01094       printf("Received HUP signal -- Reloading configs\n");
01095    if (restartnow)
01096       execvp(_argv[0], _argv);
01097    sig_flags.need_reload = 1;
01098    if (sig_alert_pipe[1] != -1)
01099       write(sig_alert_pipe[1], &a, sizeof(a));
01100    signal(num, hup_handler);
01101 }
01102 
01103 static void child_handler(int sig)
01104 {
01105    /* Must not ever ast_log or ast_verbose within signal handler */
01106    int n, status;
01107 
01108    /*
01109     * Reap all dead children -- not just one
01110     */
01111    for (n = 0; wait4(-1, &status, WNOHANG, NULL) > 0; n++)
01112       ;
01113    if (n == 0 && option_debug)   
01114       printf("Huh?  Child handler, but nobody there?\n");
01115    signal(sig, child_handler);
01116 }
01117 
01118 /*! \brief Set maximum open files */
01119 static void set_ulimit(int value)
01120 {
01121    struct rlimit l = {0, 0};
01122    
01123    if (value <= 0) {
01124       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to change max files open to invalid value %i\n",value);
01125       return;
01126    }
01127    
01128    l.rlim_cur = value;
01129    l.rlim_max = value;
01130    
01131    if (setrlimit(RLIMIT_NOFILE, &l)) {
01132       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to disable core size resource limit: %s\n",strerror(errno));
01133       return;
01134    }
01135    
01136    ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "Setting max files open to %d\n",value);
01137    
01138    return;
01139 }

01141 /*! \brief Set an X-term or screen title */
01142 static void set_title(char *text)
01143 {
01144    if (getenv("TERM") && strstr(getenv("TERM"), "xterm"))
01145       fprintf(stdout, "\033]2;%s\007", text);
01146 }
01147 
01148 static void set_icon(char *text)
01149 {
01150    if (getenv("TERM") && strstr(getenv("TERM"), "xterm"))
01151       fprintf(stdout, "\033]1;%s\007", text);
01152 }
01153 
01154 /*! \brief We set ourselves to a high priority, that we might pre-empt everything
01155    else.  If your PBX has heavy activity on it, this is a good thing.  */
01156 int ast_set_priority(int pri)
01157 {
01158    struct sched_param sched;
01159    memset(&sched, 0, sizeof(sched));
01160 #ifdef __linux__
01161    if (pri) {  
01162       sched.sched_priority = 10;
01163       if (sched_setscheduler(0, SCHED_RR, &sched)) {
01164          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to set high priority\n");
01165          return -1;
01166       } else
01167          if (option_verbose)
01168             ast_verbose("Set to realtime thread\n");
01169    } else {
01170       sched.sched_priority = 0;
01171       /* According to the manpage, these parameters can never fail. */
01172       sched_setscheduler(0, SCHED_OTHER, &sched);
01173    }
01174 #else
01175    if (pri) {
01176       if (setpriority(PRIO_PROCESS, 0, -10) == -1) {
01177          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to set high priority\n");
01178          return -1;
01179       } else
01180          if (option_verbose)
01181             ast_verbose("Set to high priority\n");
01182    } else {
01183       /* According to the manpage, these parameters can never fail. */
01184       setpriority(PRIO_PROCESS, 0, 0);
01185    }
01186 #endif
01187    return 0;
01188 }
01189 
01190 static void ast_run_atexits(void)
01191 {
01192    struct ast_atexit *ae;
01193    AST_LIST_LOCK(&atexits);
01194    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE(&atexits, ae, list) {
01195       if (ae->func) 
01196          ae->func();
01197    }
01198    AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&atexits);
01199 }
01200 
01201 static void quit_handler(int num, int nice, int safeshutdown, int restart)
01202 {
01203    char filename[80] = "";
01204    time_t s,e;
01205    int x;
01206    /* Try to get as many CDRs as possible submitted to the backend engines (if in batch mode) */
01207    ast_cdr_engine_term();
01208    if (safeshutdown) {
01209       shuttingdown = 1;
01210       if (!nice) {
01211          /* Begin shutdown routine, hanging up active channels */
01212          ast_begin_shutdown(1);
01213          if (option_verbose && ast_opt_console)
01214             ast_verbose("Beginning asterisk %s....\n", restart ? "restart" : "shutdown");
01215          time(&s);
01216          for (;;) {
01217             time(&e);
01218             /* Wait up to 15 seconds for all channels to go away */
01219             if ((e - s) > 15)
01220                break;
01221             if (!ast_active_channels())
01222                break;
01223             if (!shuttingdown)
01224                break;
01225             /* Sleep 1/10 of a second */
01226             usleep(100000);
01227          }
01228       } else {
01229          if (nice < 2)
01230             ast_begin_shutdown(0);
01231          if (option_verbose && ast_opt_console)
01232             ast_verbose("Waiting for inactivity to perform %s...\n", restart ? "restart" : "halt");
01233          for (;;) {
01234             if (!ast_active_channels())
01235                break;
01236             if (!shuttingdown)
01237                break;
01238             sleep(1);
01239          }
01240       }
01241 
01242       if (!shuttingdown) {
01243          if (option_verbose && ast_opt_console)
01244             ast_verbose("Asterisk %s cancelled.\n", restart ? "restart" : "shutdown");
01245          return;
01246       }
01247    }
01248    if (ast_opt_console || ast_opt_remote) {
01249       if (getenv("HOME")) 
01250          snprintf(filename, sizeof(filename), "%s/.asterisk_history", getenv("HOME"));
01251       if (!ast_strlen_zero(filename))
01252          ast_el_write_history(filename);
01253       if (el != NULL)
01254          el_end(el);
01255       if (el_hist != NULL)
01256          history_end(el_hist);
01257    }
01258    if (option_verbose)
01259       ast_verbose("Executing last minute cleanups\n");
01260    ast_run_atexits();
01261    /* Called on exit */
01262    if (option_verbose && ast_opt_console)
01263       ast_verbose("Asterisk %s ending (%d).\n", ast_active_channels() ? "uncleanly" : "cleanly", num);
01264    if (option_debug)
01265       ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Asterisk ending (%d).\n", num);
01266    manager_event(EVENT_FLAG_SYSTEM, "Shutdown", "Shutdown: %s\r\nRestart: %s\r\n", ast_active_channels() ? "Uncleanly" : "Cleanly", restart ? "True" : "False");
01267    if (ast_socket > -1) {
01268       pthread_cancel(lthread);
01269       close(ast_socket);
01270       ast_socket = -1;
01271       unlink(ast_config_AST_SOCKET);
01272    }
01273    if (ast_consock > -1)
01274       close(ast_consock);
01275    if (!ast_opt_remote)
01276       unlink(ast_config_AST_PID);
01277    printf(term_quit());
01278    if (restart) {
01279       if (option_verbose || ast_opt_console)
01280          ast_verbose("Preparing for Asterisk restart...\n");
01281       /* Mark all FD's for closing on exec */
01282       for (x=3; x < 32768; x++) {
01283          fcntl(x, F_SETFD, FD_CLOEXEC);
01284       }
01285       if (option_verbose || ast_opt_console)
01286          ast_verbose("Asterisk is now restarting...\n");
01287       restartnow = 1;
01288 
01289       /* close logger */
01290       close_logger();
01291 
01292       /* If there is a consolethread running send it a SIGHUP 
01293          so it can execvp, otherwise we can do it ourselves */
01294       if ((consolethread != AST_PTHREADT_NULL) && (consolethread != pthread_self())) {
01295          pthread_kill(consolethread, SIGHUP);
01296          /* Give the signal handler some time to complete */
01297          sleep(2);
01298       } else
01299          execvp(_argv[0], _argv);
01300    
01301    } else {
01302       /* close logger */
01303       close_logger();
01304    }
01305    exit(0);
01306 }
01307 
01308 static void __quit_handler(int num)
01309 {
01310    int a = 0;
01311    sig_flags.need_quit = 1;
01312    if (sig_alert_pipe[1] != -1)
01313       write(sig_alert_pipe[1], &a, sizeof(a));
01314    /* There is no need to restore the signal handler here, since the app
01315     * is going to exit */
01316 }
01317 
01318 static const char *fix_header(char *outbuf, int maxout, const char *s, char *cmp)
01319 {
01320    const char *c;
01321    if (!strncmp(s, cmp, strlen(cmp))) {
01322       c = s + strlen(cmp);
01323       term_color(outbuf, cmp, COLOR_GRAY, 0, maxout);
01324       return c;
01325    }
01326    return NULL;
01327 }
01328 
01329 static void console_verboser(const char *s)
01330 {
01331    char tmp[80];
01332    const char *c = NULL;
01333 
01334    if ((c = fix_header(tmp, sizeof(tmp), s, VERBOSE_PREFIX_4)) ||
01335        (c = fix_header(tmp, sizeof(tmp), s, VERBOSE_PREFIX_3)) ||
01336        (c = fix_header(tmp, sizeof(tmp), s, VERBOSE_PREFIX_2)) ||
01337        (c = fix_header(tmp, sizeof(tmp), s, VERBOSE_PREFIX_1))) {
01338       fputs(tmp, stdout);
01339       fputs(c, stdout);
01340    } else
01341       fputs(s, stdout);
01342 
01343    fflush(stdout);
01344    
01345    /* Wake up a poll()ing console */
01346    if (ast_opt_console && consolethread != AST_PTHREADT_NULL)
01347       pthread_kill(consolethread, SIGURG);
01348 }
01349 
01350 static int ast_all_zeros(char *s)
01351 {
01352    while (*s) {
01353       if (*s > 32)
01354          return 0;
01355       s++;  
01356    }
01357    return 1;
01358 }
01359 
01360 static void consolehandler(char *s)
01361 {
01362    printf(term_end());
01363    fflush(stdout);
01364 
01365    /* Called when readline data is available */
01366    if (!ast_all_zeros(s))
01367       ast_el_add_history(s);
01368    /* The real handler for bang */
01369    if (s[0] == '!') {
01370       if (s[1])
01371          ast_safe_system(s+1);
01372       else
01373          ast_safe_system(getenv("SHELL") ? getenv("SHELL") : "/bin/sh");
01374    } else 
01375       ast_cli_command(STDOUT_FILENO, s);
01376 }
01377 
01378 static int remoteconsolehandler(char *s)
01379 {
01380    int ret = 0;
01381 
01382    /* Called when readline data is available */
01383    if (!ast_all_zeros(s))
01384       ast_el_add_history(s);
01385    /* The real handler for bang */
01386    if (s[0] == '!') {
01387       if (s[1])
01388          ast_safe_system(s+1);
01389       else
01390          ast_safe_system(getenv("SHELL") ? getenv("SHELL") : "/bin/sh");
01391       ret = 1;
01392    }
01393    if ((strncasecmp(s, "quit", 4) == 0 || strncasecmp(s, "exit", 4) == 0) &&
01394        (s[4] == '\0' || isspace(s[4]))) {
01395       quit_handler(0, 0, 0, 0);
01396       ret = 1;
01397    }
01398 
01399    return ret;
01400 }

01456 static int handle_version(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
01457 {
01458    if (argc != 3)
01459       return RESULT_SHOWUSAGE;
01460    ast_cli(fd, "Asterisk %s built by %s @ %s on a %s running %s on %s\n",
01461       ASTERISK_VERSION, ast_build_user, ast_build_hostname,
01462       ast_build_machine, ast_build_os, ast_build_date);
01463    return RESULT_SUCCESS;
01464 }
01465 
01466 #if defined(MARKO_BDAY)
01467 static void print_markobdaystr(int fd, time_t timeval, const char *prefix)
01468 {
01469    int x; /* the main part - years, weeks, etc. */
01470    struct ast_str *out;
01471 
01472 #define SECOND (1)
01473 #define MINUTE (SECOND*60)
01474 #define HOUR (MINUTE*60)
01475 #define DAY (HOUR*24)
01476 #define WEEK (DAY*7)
01477 #define YEAR (DAY*365)
01478 #define NEEDCOMMA(x) ((x)? ",": "") /* define if we need a comma */
01479    if (timeval < 0)  /* invalid, nothing to show */
01480       return;
01481 
01482    out = ast_str_alloca(256);
01483    if (timeval > YEAR) {
01484       x = (timeval / YEAR);
01485       timeval -= (x * YEAR);
01486       ast_str_append(&out, 0, "%d year%s%s ", x, ESS(x),NEEDCOMMA(timeval));
01487    }
01488    if (timeval > WEEK) {
01489       x = (timeval / WEEK);
01490       timeval -= (x * WEEK);
01491       ast_str_append(&out, 0, "%d week%s%s ", x, ESS(x),NEEDCOMMA(timeval));
01492    }
01493    if (timeval > DAY) {
01494       x = (timeval / DAY);
01495       timeval -= (x * DAY);
01496       ast_str_append(&out, 0, "%d day%s%s ", x, ESS(x),NEEDCOMMA(timeval));
01497    }
01498    if (timeval > HOUR) {
01499       x = (timeval / HOUR);
01500       timeval -= (x * HOUR);
01501       ast_str_append(&out, 0, "%d hour%s%s ", x, ESS(x),NEEDCOMMA(timeval));
01502    }
01503    if (timeval > MINUTE) {
01504       x = (timeval / MINUTE);
01505       timeval -= (x * MINUTE);
01506       ast_str_append(&out, 0, "%d minute%s%s ", x, ESS(x),NEEDCOMMA(timeval));
01507    }
01508    x = timeval;
01509    if (x > 0 || out->used == 0)  /* if there is nothing, print 0 seconds */
01510       ast_str_append(&out, 0, "%d second%s ", x, ESS(x));
01511    ast_cli(fd, "%s: %s\n", prefix, out->str);
01512 }
01513 
01514 static int handle_markobday(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
01515 {
01516    time_t markobdaystarttime = 1176008400; /* 2007-04-08 00:00:00 */
01517    time_t markobdayendtime = 1176094799;   /* 2007-04-08 23:59:59 */
01518    time_t curtime;
01519 
01520    curtime = time(NULL);
01521    if (markobdaystarttime && markobdayendtime) {
01522       if (curtime >= markobdaystarttime && curtime <= markobdayendtime)
01523          ast_cli(fd, "Happy 30th birthday Marko!\n");
01524       else if (curtime > markobdayendtime)
01525          print_markobdaystr(fd, curtime - markobdayendtime, "Time since Mark Spencer's 30th birthday");
01526       else
01527          print_markobdaystr(fd, markobdaystarttime - curtime, "Time until Mark Spencer's 30th birthday");
01528    }
01529    return RESULT_SUCCESS;
01530 }
01531 #endif
