01746 
01747 static int ast_el_read_char(EditLine *el, char *cp)
01748 {
01749    int num_read = 0;
01750    int lastpos = 0;
01751    struct pollfd fds[2];
01752    int res;
01753    int max;
01754    char buf[512];
01755 
01756    for (;;) {
01757       max = 1;
01758       fds[0].fd = ast_consock;
01759       fds[0].events = POLLIN;
01760       if (!ast_opt_exec) {
01761          fds[1].fd = STDIN_FILENO;
01762          fds[1].events = POLLIN;
01763          max++;
01764       }
01765       res = poll(fds, max, -1);
01766       if (res < 0) {
01767          if (errno == EINTR)
01768             continue;
01769          ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "poll failed: %s\n", strerror(errno));
01770          break;
01771       }
01772 
01773       if (!ast_opt_exec && fds[1].revents) {
01774          num_read = read(STDIN_FILENO, cp, 1);
01775          if (num_read < 1) {
01776             break;
01777          } else 
01778             return (num_read);
01779       }
01780       if (fds[0].revents) {
01781          res = read(ast_consock, buf, sizeof(buf) - 1);
01782          /* if the remote side disappears exit */
01783          if (res < 1) {
01784             fprintf(stderr, "\nDisconnected from Asterisk server\n");
01785             if (!ast_opt_reconnect) {
01786                quit_handler(0, 0, 0, 0);
01787             } else {
01788                int tries;
01789                int reconnects_per_second = 20;
01790                fprintf(stderr, "Attempting to reconnect for 30 seconds\n");
01791                for (tries=0; tries < 30 * reconnects_per_second; tries++) {
01792                   if (ast_tryconnect()) {
01793                      fprintf(stderr, "Reconnect succeeded after %.3f seconds\n", 1.0 / reconnects_per_second * tries);
01794                      printf(term_quit());
01795                      WELCOME_MESSAGE;
01796                      break;
01797                   } else
01798                      usleep(1000000 / reconnects_per_second);
01799                }
01800                if (tries >= 30 * reconnects_per_second) {
01801                   fprintf(stderr, "Failed to reconnect for 30 seconds.  Quitting.\n");
01802                   quit_handler(0, 0, 0, 0);
01803                }
01804             }
01805          }
01806 
01807          buf[res] = '\0';
01808 
01809          if (!ast_opt_exec && !lastpos)
01810             write(STDOUT_FILENO, "\r", 1);
01811          write(STDOUT_FILENO, buf, res);
01812          if ((buf[res-1] == '\n') || (buf[res-2] == '\n')) {
01813             *cp = CC_REFRESH;
01814             return(1);
01815          } else
01816             lastpos = 1;
01817       }
01818    }
01819 
01820    *cp = '\0';
01821    return (0);
01822 }
01823 
01824 static char *cli_prompt(EditLine *el)
01825 {
01826    static char prompt[200];
01827    char *pfmt;
01828    int color_used = 0;
01829    char term_code[20];
01830 
01831    if ((pfmt = getenv("ASTERISK_PROMPT"))) {
01832       char *t = pfmt, *p = prompt;
01833       memset(prompt, 0, sizeof(prompt));
01834       while (*t != '\0' && *p < sizeof(prompt)) {
01835          if (*t == '%') {
01836             char hostname[MAXHOSTNAMELEN]="";
01837             int i;
01838             time_t ts;
01839             struct tm tm;
01840 #ifdef linux
01841             FILE *LOADAVG;
01842 #endif
01843             int fgcolor = COLOR_WHITE, bgcolor = COLOR_BLACK;
01844 
01845             t++;
01846             switch (*t) {
01847             case 'C': /* color */
01848                t++;
01849                if (sscanf(t, "%d;%d%n", &fgcolor, &bgcolor, &i) == 2) {
01850                   strncat(p, term_color_code(term_code, fgcolor, bgcolor, sizeof(term_code)),sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt) - 1);
01851                   t += i - 1;
01852                } else if (sscanf(t, "%d%n", &fgcolor, &i) == 1) {
01853                   strncat(p, term_color_code(term_code, fgcolor, 0, sizeof(term_code)),sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt) - 1);
01854                   t += i - 1;
01855                }
01856 
01857                /* If the color has been reset correctly, then there's no need to reset it later */
01858                color_used = ((fgcolor == COLOR_WHITE) && (bgcolor == COLOR_BLACK)) ? 0 : 1;
01859                break;
01860             case 'd': /* date */
01861                memset(&tm, 0, sizeof(tm));
01862                time(&ts);
01863                if (localtime_r(&ts, &tm)) 
01864                   strftime(p, sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt), "%Y-%m-%d", &tm);
01865                break;
01866             case 'h': /* hostname */
01867                if (!gethostname(hostname, sizeof(hostname) - 1))
01868                   strncat(p, hostname, sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt) - 1);
01869                else
01870                   strncat(p, "localhost", sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt) - 1);
01871                break;
01872             case 'H': /* short hostname */
01873                if (!gethostname(hostname, sizeof(hostname) - 1)) {
01874                   for (i = 0; i < sizeof(hostname); i++) {
01875                      if (hostname[i] == '.') {
01876                         hostname[i] = '\0';
01877                         break;
01878                      }
01879                   }
01880                   strncat(p, hostname, sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt) - 1);
01881                } else
01882                   strncat(p, "localhost", sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt) - 1);
01883                break;
01884 #ifdef linux
01885             case 'l': /* load avg */
01886                t++;
01887                if ((LOADAVG = fopen("/proc/loadavg", "r"))) {
01888                   float avg1, avg2, avg3;
01889                   int actproc, totproc, npid, which;
01890                   fscanf(LOADAVG, "%f %f %f %d/%d %d",
01891                      &avg1, &avg2, &avg3, &actproc, &totproc, &npid);
01892                   if (sscanf(t, "%d", &which) == 1) {
01893                      switch (which) {
01894                      case 1:
01895                         snprintf(p, sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt), "%.2f", avg1);
01896                         break;
01897                      case 2:
01898                         snprintf(p, sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt), "%.2f", avg2);
01899                         break;
01900                      case 3:
01901                         snprintf(p, sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt), "%.2f", avg3);
01902                         break;
01903                      case 4:
01904                         snprintf(p, sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt), "%d/%d", actproc, totproc);
01905                         break;
01906                      case 5:
01907                         snprintf(p, sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt), "%d", npid);
01908                         break;
01909                      }
01910                   }
01911                }
01912                break;
01913 #endif
01914             case 's': /* Asterisk system name (from asterisk.conf) */
01915                strncat(p, ast_config_AST_SYSTEM_NAME, sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt) - 1);
01916                break;
01917             case 't': /* time */
01918                memset(&tm, 0, sizeof(tm));
01919                time(&ts);
01920                if (localtime_r(&ts, &tm))
01921                   strftime(p, sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt), "%H:%M:%S", &tm);
01922                break;
01923             case '#': /* process console or remote? */
01924                if (!ast_opt_remote) 
01925                   strncat(p, "#", sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt) - 1);
01926                else
01927                   strncat(p, ">", sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt) - 1);
01928                break;
01929             case '%': /* literal % */
01930                strncat(p, "%", sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt) - 1);
01931                break;
01932             case '\0': /* % is last character - prevent bug */
01933                t--;
01934                break;
01935             }
01936             while (*p != '\0')
01937                p++;
01938             t++;
01939          } else {
01940             *p = *t;
01941             p++;
01942             t++;
01943          }
01944       }
01945       if (color_used) {
01946          /* Force colors back to normal at end */
01947          term_color_code(term_code, COLOR_WHITE, COLOR_BLACK, sizeof(term_code));
01948          if (strlen(term_code) > sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt))
01949             strncat(prompt + sizeof(prompt) - strlen(term_code) - 1, term_code, strlen(term_code));
01950          else
01951             strncat(p, term_code, sizeof(term_code));
01952       }
01953    } else if (remotehostname)
01954       snprintf(prompt, sizeof(prompt), ASTERISK_PROMPT2, remotehostname);
01955    else
01956       snprintf(prompt, sizeof(prompt), ASTERISK_PROMPT);
01957 
01958    return(prompt);   
01959 }
01960 
01961 static char **ast_el_strtoarr(char *buf)
01962 {
01963    char **match_list = NULL, *retstr;
01964    size_t match_list_len;
01965    int matches = 0;
01966 
01967    match_list_len = 1;
01968    while ( (retstr = strsep(&buf, " ")) != NULL) {
01969 
01970       if (!strcmp(retstr, AST_CLI_COMPLETE_EOF))
01971          break;
01972       if (matches + 1 >= match_list_len) {
01973          match_list_len <<= 1;
01974          if (!(match_list = ast_realloc(match_list, match_list_len * sizeof(char *)))) {
01975             /* TODO: Handle memory allocation failure */
01976          }
01977       }
01978 
01979       match_list[matches++] = strdup(retstr);
01980    }
01981 
01982    if (!match_list)
01983       return (char **) NULL;
01984 
01985    if (matches >= match_list_len) {
01986       if (!(match_list = ast_realloc(match_list, (match_list_len + 1) * sizeof(char *)))) {
01987          /* TODO: Handle memory allocation failure */
01988       }
01989    }
01990 
01991    match_list[matches] = (char *) NULL;
01992 
01993    return match_list;
01994 }
01995 
01996 static int ast_el_sort_compare(const void *i1, const void *i2)
01997 {
01998    char *s1, *s2;
01999 
02000    s1 = ((char **)i1)[0];
02001    s2 = ((char **)i2)[0];
02002 
02003    return strcasecmp(s1, s2);
02004 }
02005 
02006 static int ast_cli_display_match_list(char **matches, int len, int max)
02007 {
02008    int i, idx, limit, count;
02009    int screenwidth = 0;
02010    int numoutput = 0, numoutputline = 0;
02011 
02012    screenwidth = ast_get_termcols(STDOUT_FILENO);
02013 
02014    /* find out how many entries can be put on one line, with two spaces between strings */
02015    limit = screenwidth / (max + 2);
02016    if (limit == 0)
02017       limit = 1;
02018 
02019    /* how many lines of output */
02020    count = len / limit;
02021    if (count * limit < len)
02022       count++;
02023 
02024    idx = 1;
02025 
02026    qsort(&matches[0], (size_t)(len), sizeof(char *), ast_el_sort_compare);
02027 
02028    for (; count > 0; count--) {
02029       numoutputline = 0;
02030       for (i=0; i < limit && matches[idx]; i++, idx++) {
02031 
02032          /* Don't print dupes */
02033          if ( (matches[idx+1] != NULL && strcmp(matches[idx], matches[idx+1]) == 0 ) ) {
02034             i--;
02035             free(matches[idx]);
02036             matches[idx] = NULL;
02037             continue;
02038          }
02039 
02040          numoutput++;
02041          numoutputline++;
02042          fprintf(stdout, "%-*s  ", max, matches[idx]);
02043          free(matches[idx]);
02044          matches[idx] = NULL;
02045       }
02046       if (numoutputline > 0)
02047          fprintf(stdout, "\n");
02048    }
02049 
02050    return numoutput;
02051 }
02052 
02053 
02054 static char *cli_complete(EditLine *el, int ch)
02055 {
02056    int len = 0;
02057    char *ptr;
02058    int nummatches = 0;
02059    char **matches;
02060    int retval = CC_ERROR;
02061    char buf[2048];
02062    int res;
02063 
02064    LineInfo *lf = (LineInfo *)el_line(el);
02065 
02066    *(char *)lf->cursor = '\0';
02067    ptr = (char *)lf->cursor;
02068    if (ptr) {
02069       while (ptr > lf->buffer) {
02070          if (isspace(*ptr)) {
02071             ptr++;
02072             break;
02073          }
02074          ptr--;
02075       }
02076    }
02077 
02078    len = lf->cursor - ptr;
02079 
02080    if (ast_opt_remote) {
02081       snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf),"_COMMAND NUMMATCHES \"%s\" \"%s\"", lf->buffer, ptr); 
02082       fdprint(ast_consock, buf);
02083       res = read(ast_consock, buf, sizeof(buf));
02084       buf[res] = '\0';
02085       nummatches = atoi(buf);
02086 
02087       if (nummatches > 0) {
02088          char *mbuf;
02089          int mlen = 0, maxmbuf = 2048;
02090          /* Start with a 2048 byte buffer */       
02091          if (!(mbuf = ast_malloc(maxmbuf)))
02092             return (char *)(CC_ERROR);
02093          snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf),"_COMMAND MATCHESARRAY \"%s\" \"%s\"", lf->buffer, ptr); 
02094          fdprint(ast_consock, buf);
02095          res = 0;
02096          mbuf[0] = '\0';
02097          while (!strstr(mbuf, AST_CLI_COMPLETE_EOF) && res != -1) {
02098             if (mlen + 1024 > maxmbuf) {
02099                /* Every step increment buffer 1024 bytes */
02100                maxmbuf += 1024;              
02101                if (!(mbuf = ast_realloc(mbuf, maxmbuf)))
02102                   return (char *)(CC_ERROR);
02103             }
02104             /* Only read 1024 bytes at a time */
02105             res = read(ast_consock, mbuf + mlen, 1024);
02106             if (res > 0)
02107                mlen += res;
02108          }
02109          mbuf[mlen] = '\0';
02110 
02111          matches = ast_el_strtoarr(mbuf);
02112          free(mbuf);
02113       } else
02114          matches = (char **) NULL;
02115    } else {
02116       char **p, *oldbuf=NULL;
02117       nummatches = 0;
02118       matches = ast_cli_completion_matches((char *)lf->buffer,ptr);
02119       for (p = matches; p && *p; p++) {
02120          if (!oldbuf || strcmp(*p,oldbuf))
02121             nummatches++;
02122          oldbuf = *p;
02123       }
02124    }
02125 
02126    if (matches) {
02127       int i;
02128       int matches_num, maxlen, match_len;
02129 
02130       if (matches[0][0] != '\0') {
02131          el_deletestr(el, (int) len);
02132          el_insertstr(el, matches[0]);
02133          retval = CC_REFRESH;
02134       }
02135 
02136       if (nummatches == 1) {
02137          /* Found an exact match */
02138          el_insertstr(el, " ");
02139          retval = CC_REFRESH;
02140       } else {
02141          /* Must be more than one match */
02142          for (i=1, maxlen=0; matches[i]; i++) {
02143             match_len = strlen(matches[i]);
02144             if (match_len > maxlen)
02145                maxlen = match_len;
02146          }
02147          matches_num = i - 1;
02148          if (matches_num >1) {
02149             fprintf(stdout, "\n");
02150             ast_cli_display_match_list(matches, nummatches, maxlen);
02151             retval = CC_REDISPLAY;
02152          } else { 
02153             el_insertstr(el," ");
02154             retval = CC_REFRESH;
02155          }
02156       }
02157       for (i = 0; matches[i]; i++)
02158          free(matches[i]);
02159       free(matches);
02160    }
02161 
02162    return (char *)(long)retval;
02163 }
02164 
02165 static int ast_el_initialize(void)
02166 {
02167    HistEvent ev;
02168    char *editor = getenv("AST_EDITOR");
02169 
02170    if (el != NULL)
02171       el_end(el);
02172    if (el_hist != NULL)
02173       history_end(el_hist);
02174 
02175    el = el_init("asterisk", stdin, stdout, stderr);
02176    el_set(el, EL_PROMPT, cli_prompt);
02177 
02178    el_set(el, EL_EDITMODE, 1);      
02179    el_set(el, EL_EDITOR, editor ? editor : "emacs");     
02180    el_hist = history_init();
02181    if (!el || !el_hist)
02182       return -1;
02183 
02184    /* setup history with 100 entries */
02185    history(el_hist, &ev, H_SETSIZE, 100);
02186 
02187    el_set(el, EL_HIST, history, el_hist);
02188 
02189    el_set(el, EL_ADDFN, "ed-complete", "Complete argument", cli_complete);
02190    /* Bind <tab> to command completion */
02191    el_set(el, EL_BIND, "^I", "ed-complete", NULL);
02192    /* Bind ? to command completion */
02193    el_set(el, EL_BIND, "?", "ed-complete", NULL);
02194    /* Bind ^D to redisplay */
02195    el_set(el, EL_BIND, "^D", "ed-redisplay", NULL);
02196 
02197    return 0;
02198 }
02199 
02200 static int ast_el_add_history(char *buf)
02201 {
02202    HistEvent ev;
02203 
02204    if (el_hist == NULL || el == NULL)
02205       ast_el_initialize();
02206    if (strlen(buf) > 256)
02207       return 0;
02208    return (history(el_hist, &ev, H_ENTER, buf));
02209 }
02210 
02211 static int ast_el_write_history(char *filename)
02212 {
02213    HistEvent ev;
02214 
02215    if (el_hist == NULL || el == NULL)
02216       ast_el_initialize();
02217 
02218    return (history(el_hist, &ev, H_SAVE, filename));
02219 }
02220 
02221 static int ast_el_read_history(char *filename)
02222 {
02223    char buf[256];
02224    FILE *f;
02225    int ret = -1;
02226 
02227    if (el_hist == NULL || el == NULL)
02228       ast_el_initialize();
02229 
02230    if ((f = fopen(filename, "r")) == NULL)
02231       return ret;
02232 
02233    while (!feof(f)) {
02234       fgets(buf, sizeof(buf), f);
02235       if (!strcmp(buf, "_HiStOrY_V2_\n"))
02236          continue;
02237       if (ast_all_zeros(buf))
02238          continue;
02239       if ((ret = ast_el_add_history(buf)) == -1)
02240          break;
02241    }
02242    fclose(f);
02243 
02244    return ret;
02245 }
02246 
02247 static void ast_remotecontrol(char * data)
02248 {
02249    char buf[80];
02250    int res;
02251    char filename[80] = "";
02252    char *hostname;
02253    char *cpid;
02254    char *version;
02255    int pid;
02256    char tmp[80];
02257    char *stringp = NULL;
02258 
02259    char *ebuf;
02260    int num = 0;
02261 
02262    read(ast_consock, buf, sizeof(buf));
02263    if (data)
02264       write(ast_consock, data, strlen(data) + 1);
02265    stringp = buf;
02266    hostname = strsep(&stringp, "/");
02267    cpid = strsep(&stringp, "/");
02268    version = strsep(&stringp, "\n");
02269    if (!version)
02270       version = "<Version Unknown>";
02271    stringp = hostname;
02272    strsep(&stringp, ".");
02273    if (cpid)
02274       pid = atoi(cpid);
02275    else
02276       pid = -1;
02277    snprintf(tmp, sizeof(tmp), "core set verbose atleast %d", option_verbose);
02278    fdprint(ast_consock, tmp);
02279    snprintf(tmp, sizeof(tmp), "core set debug atleast %d", option_debug);
02280    fdprint(ast_consock, tmp);
02281 #if defined(MARKO_BDAY)
02282    snprintf(tmp, sizeof(tmp), "marko show birthday");
02283    fdprint(ast_consock, tmp);
02284 #endif
02285    if (ast_opt_mute) {
02286       snprintf(tmp, sizeof(tmp), "log and verbose output currently muted ('logger unmute' to unmute)");
02287       fdprint(ast_consock, tmp);
02288    }
02289    ast_verbose("Connected to Asterisk %s currently running on %s (pid = %d)\n", version, hostname, pid);
02290    remotehostname = hostname;
02291    if (getenv("HOME")) 
02292       snprintf(filename, sizeof(filename), "%s/.asterisk_history", getenv("HOME"));
02293    if (el_hist == NULL || el == NULL)
02294       ast_el_initialize();
02295 
02296    el_set(el, EL_GETCFN, ast_el_read_char);
02297 
02298    if (!ast_strlen_zero(filename))
02299       ast_el_read_history(filename);
02300 
02301    if (ast_opt_exec && data) {  /* hack to print output then exit if asterisk -rx is used */
02302       char tempchar;
02303       struct pollfd fds;
02304       fds.fd = ast_consock;
02305       fds.events = POLLIN;
02306       fds.revents = 0;
02307       while (poll(&fds, 1, 100) > 0)
02308          ast_el_read_char(el, &tempchar);
02309       return;
02310    }
02311    for (;;) {
02312       ebuf = (char *)el_gets(el, &num);
02313 
02314       if (!ast_strlen_zero(ebuf)) {
02315          if (ebuf[strlen(ebuf)-1] == '\n')
02316             ebuf[strlen(ebuf)-1] = '\0';
02317          if (!remoteconsolehandler(ebuf)) {
02318             res = write(ast_consock, ebuf, strlen(ebuf) + 1);
02319             if (res < 1) {
02320                ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to write: %s\n", strerror(errno));
02321                break;
02322             }
02323          }
02324       }
02325    }
02326    printf("\nDisconnected from Asterisk server\n");
02327 }
02328 
02329 static int show_version(void)
02330 {
02331    printf("Asterisk " ASTERISK_VERSION "\n");
02332    return 0;
02333 }
02334 
02335 static int show_cli_help(void) {
02336    printf("Asterisk " ASTERISK_VERSION ", Copyright (C) 1999 - 2007, Digium, Inc. and others.\n");
02337    printf("Usage: asterisk [OPTIONS]\n");
02338    printf("Valid Options:\n");
02339    printf("   -V              Display version number and exit\n");
02340    printf("   -C <configfile> Use an alternate configuration file\n");
02341    printf("   -G <group>      Run as a group other than the caller\n");
02342    printf("   -U <user>       Run as a user other than the caller\n");
02343    printf("   -c              Provide console CLI\n");
02344    printf("   -d              Enable extra debugging\n");
02345 #if HAVE_WORKING_FORK
02346    printf("   -f              Do not fork\n");
02347    printf("   -F              Always fork\n");
02348 #endif
02349    printf("   -g              Dump core in case of a crash\n");
02350    printf("   -h              This help screen\n");
02351    printf("   -i              Initialize crypto keys at startup\n");
02352    printf("   -I              Enable internal timing if Zaptel timer is available\n");
02353    printf("   -L <load>       Limit the maximum load average before rejecting new calls\n");
02354    printf("   -M <value>      Limit the maximum number of calls to the specified value\n");
02355    printf("   -m              Mute the console from debugging and verbose output\n");
02356    printf("   -n              Disable console colorization\n");
02357    printf("   -p              Run as pseudo-realtime thread\n");
02358    printf("   -q              Quiet mode (suppress output)\n");
02359    printf("   -r              Connect to Asterisk on this machine\n");
02360    printf("   -R              Connect to Asterisk, and attempt to reconnect if disconnected\n");
02361    printf("   -t              Record soundfiles in /var/tmp and move them where they belong after they are done.\n");
02362    printf("   -T              Display the time in [Mmm dd hh:mm:ss] format for each line of output to the CLI.\n");
02363    printf("   -v              Increase verbosity (multiple v's = more verbose)\n");
02364    printf("   -x <cmd>        Execute command <cmd> (only valid with -r)\n");
02365    printf("\n");
02366    return 0;
02367 }
02368 
02369 static void ast_readconfig(void) 
02370 {
02371    struct ast_config *cfg;
02372    struct ast_variable *v;
02373    char *config = AST_CONFIG_FILE;
02374    char hostname[MAXHOSTNAMELEN] = "";
02375 
02376    if (ast_opt_override_config) {
02377       cfg = ast_config_load(ast_config_AST_CONFIG_FILE);
02378       if (!cfg)
02379          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to open specified master config file '%s', using built-in defaults\n", ast_config_AST_CONFIG_FILE);
02380    } else 
02381       cfg = ast_config_load(config);
02382 
02383    /* init with buildtime config */
02384    ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_CONFIG_DIR, AST_CONFIG_DIR, sizeof(ast_config_AST_CONFIG_DIR));
02385    ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_SPOOL_DIR, AST_SPOOL_DIR, sizeof(ast_config_AST_SPOOL_DIR));
02386    ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_MODULE_DIR, AST_MODULE_DIR, sizeof(ast_config_AST_MODULE_DIR));
02387    snprintf(ast_config_AST_MONITOR_DIR, sizeof(ast_config_AST_MONITOR_DIR) - 1, "%s/monitor", ast_config_AST_SPOOL_DIR);
02388    ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_VAR_DIR, AST_VAR_DIR, sizeof(ast_config_AST_VAR_DIR));
02389    ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_DATA_DIR, AST_DATA_DIR, sizeof(ast_config_AST_DATA_DIR));
02390    ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_LOG_DIR, AST_LOG_DIR, sizeof(ast_config_AST_LOG_DIR));
02391    ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_AGI_DIR, AST_AGI_DIR, sizeof(ast_config_AST_AGI_DIR));
02392    ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_DB, AST_DB, sizeof(ast_config_AST_DB));
02393    ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_KEY_DIR, AST_KEY_DIR, sizeof(ast_config_AST_KEY_DIR));
02394    ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_PID, AST_PID, sizeof(ast_config_AST_PID));
02395    ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_SOCKET, AST_SOCKET, sizeof(ast_config_AST_SOCKET));
02396    ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_RUN_DIR, AST_RUN_DIR, sizeof(ast_config_AST_RUN_DIR));
02397 
02398    /* no asterisk.conf? no problem, use buildtime config! */
02399    if (!cfg) {
02400       return;
02401    }
02402 
02403    for (v = ast_variable_browse(cfg, "files"); v; v = v->next) {
02404       if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "astctlpermissions"))
02405          ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_CTL_PERMISSIONS, v->value, sizeof(ast_config_AST_CTL_PERMISSIONS));
02406       else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "astctlowner"))
02407          ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_CTL_OWNER, v->value, sizeof(ast_config_AST_CTL_OWNER));
02408       else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "astctlgroup"))
02409          ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_CTL_GROUP, v->value, sizeof(ast_config_AST_CTL_GROUP));
02410       else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "astctl"))
02411          ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_CTL, v->value, sizeof(ast_config_AST_CTL));
02412    }
02413 
02414    for (v = ast_variable_browse(cfg, "directories"); v; v = v->next) {
02415       if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "astetcdir")) {
02416          ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_CONFIG_DIR, v->value, sizeof(ast_config_AST_CONFIG_DIR));
02417       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "astspooldir")) {
02418          ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_SPOOL_DIR, v->value, sizeof(ast_config_AST_SPOOL_DIR));
02419          snprintf(ast_config_AST_MONITOR_DIR, sizeof(ast_config_AST_MONITOR_DIR) - 1, "%s/monitor", v->value);
02420       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "astvarlibdir")) {
02421          ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_VAR_DIR, v->value, sizeof(ast_config_AST_VAR_DIR));
02422          snprintf(ast_config_AST_DB, sizeof(ast_config_AST_DB), "%s/astdb", v->value);
02423       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "astdatadir")) {
02424          ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_DATA_DIR, v->value, sizeof(ast_config_AST_DATA_DIR));
02425          snprintf(ast_config_AST_KEY_DIR, sizeof(ast_config_AST_KEY_DIR), "%s/keys", v->value);
02426       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "astlogdir")) {
02427          ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_LOG_DIR, v->value, sizeof(ast_config_AST_LOG_DIR));
02428       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "astagidir")) {
02429          ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_AGI_DIR, v->value, sizeof(ast_config_AST_AGI_DIR));
02430       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "astrundir")) {
02431          snprintf(ast_config_AST_PID, sizeof(ast_config_AST_PID), "%s/%s", v->value, "asterisk.pid");
02432          snprintf(ast_config_AST_SOCKET, sizeof(ast_config_AST_SOCKET), "%s/%s", v->value, ast_config_AST_CTL);
02433          ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_RUN_DIR, v->value, sizeof(ast_config_AST_RUN_DIR));
02434       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "astmoddir")) {
02435          ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_MODULE_DIR, v->value, sizeof(ast_config_AST_MODULE_DIR));
02436       }
02437    }
02438 
02439    for (v = ast_variable_browse(cfg, "options"); v; v = v->next) {
02440       /* verbose level (-v at startup) */
02441       if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "verbose")) {
02442          option_verbose = atoi(v->value);
02443       /* whether or not to force timestamping in CLI verbose output. (-T at startup) */
02444       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "timestamp")) {
02445          ast_set2_flag(&ast_options, ast_true(v->value), AST_OPT_FLAG_TIMESTAMP);
02446       /* whether or not to support #exec in config files */
02447       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "execincludes")) {
02448          ast_set2_flag(&ast_options, ast_true(v->value), AST_OPT_FLAG_EXEC_INCLUDES);
02449       /* debug level (-d at startup) */
02450       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "debug")) {
02451          option_debug = 0;
02452          if (sscanf(v->value, "%d", &option_debug) != 1) {
02453             option_debug = ast_true(v->value);
02454          }
02455 #if HAVE_WORKING_FORK
02456       /* Disable forking (-f at startup) */
02457       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "nofork")) {
02458          ast_set2_flag(&ast_options, ast_true(v->value), AST_OPT_FLAG_NO_FORK);
02459       /* Always fork, even if verbose or debug are enabled (-F at startup) */
02460       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "alwaysfork")) {
02461          ast_set2_flag(&ast_options, ast_true(v->value), AST_OPT_FLAG_ALWAYS_FORK);
02462 #endif
02463       /* Run quietly (-q at startup ) */
02464       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "quiet")) {
02465          ast_set2_flag(&ast_options, ast_true(v->value), AST_OPT_FLAG_QUIET);
02466       /* Run as console (-c at startup, implies nofork) */
02467       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "console")) {
02468          ast_set2_flag(&ast_options, ast_true(v->value), AST_OPT_FLAG_CONSOLE);
02469       /* Run with high priority if the O/S permits (-p at startup) */
02470       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "highpriority")) {
02471          ast_set2_flag(&ast_options, ast_true(v->value), AST_OPT_FLAG_HIGH_PRIORITY);
02472       /* Initialize RSA auth keys (IAX2) (-i at startup) */
02473       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "initcrypto")) {
02474          ast_set2_flag(&ast_options, ast_true(v->value), AST_OPT_FLAG_INIT_KEYS);
02475       /* Disable ANSI colors for console (-c at startup) */
02476       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "nocolor")) {
02477          ast_set2_flag(&ast_options, ast_true(v->value), AST_OPT_FLAG_NO_COLOR);
02478       /* Disable some usage warnings for picky people :p */
02479       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "dontwarn")) {
02480          ast_set2_flag(&ast_options, ast_true(v->value), AST_OPT_FLAG_DONT_WARN);
02481       /* Dump core in case of crash (-g) */
02482       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "dumpcore")) {
02483          ast_set2_flag(&ast_options, ast_true(v->value), AST_OPT_FLAG_DUMP_CORE);
02484       /* Cache recorded sound files to another directory during recording */
02485       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "cache_record_files")) {
02486          ast_set2_flag(&ast_options, ast_true(v->value), AST_OPT_FLAG_CACHE_RECORD_FILES);
02487       /* Specify cache directory */
02488       }  else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "record_cache_dir")) {
02489          ast_copy_string(record_cache_dir, v->value, AST_CACHE_DIR_LEN);
02490       /* Build transcode paths via SLINEAR, instead of directly */
02491       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "transcode_via_sln")) {
02492          ast_set2_flag(&ast_options, ast_true(v->value), AST_OPT_FLAG_TRANSCODE_VIA_SLIN);
02493       /* Transmit SLINEAR silence while a channel is being recorded */
02494       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "transmit_silence_during_record")) {
02495          ast_set2_flag(&ast_options, ast_true(v->value), AST_OPT_FLAG_TRANSMIT_SILENCE);
02496       /* Enable internal timing */
02497       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "internal_timing")) {
02498          ast_set2_flag(&ast_options, ast_true(v->value), AST_OPT_FLAG_INTERNAL_TIMING);
02499       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "maxcalls")) {
02500          if ((sscanf(v->value, "%d", &option_maxcalls) != 1) || (option_maxcalls < 0)) {
02501             option_maxcalls = 0;
02502          }
02503       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "maxload")) {
02504          double test[1];
02505 
02506          if (getloadavg(test, 1) == -1) {
02507             ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Cannot obtain load average on this system. 'maxload' option disabled.\n");
02508             option_maxload = 0.0;
02509          } else if ((sscanf(v->value, "%lf", &option_maxload) != 1) || (option_maxload < 0.0)) {
02510             option_maxload = 0.0;
02511          }
02512       /* Set the maximum amount of open files */
02513       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "maxfiles")) {
02514          option_maxfiles = atoi(v->value);
02515          set_ulimit(option_maxfiles);
02516       /* What user to run as */
02517       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "runuser")) {
02518          ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_RUN_USER, v->value, sizeof(ast_config_AST_RUN_USER));
02519       /* What group to run as */
02520       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "rungroup")) {
02521          ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_RUN_GROUP, v->value, sizeof(ast_config_AST_RUN_GROUP));
02522       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "systemname")) {
02523          ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_SYSTEM_NAME, v->value, sizeof(ast_config_AST_SYSTEM_NAME));
02524       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "autosystemname")) {
02525          if (ast_true(v->value)) {
02526             if (!gethostname(hostname, sizeof(hostname) - 1))
02527                ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_SYSTEM_NAME, hostname, sizeof(ast_config_AST_SYSTEM_NAME));
02528             else {
02529                if (ast_strlen_zero(ast_config_AST_SYSTEM_NAME)){
02530                   ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_SYSTEM_NAME, "localhost", sizeof(ast_config_AST_SYSTEM_NAME));
02531                }
02532                ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Cannot obtain hostname for this system.  Using '%s' instead.\n", ast_config_AST_SYSTEM_NAME);
02533             }
02534          }
02535       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "languageprefix")) {
02536          ast_language_is_prefix = ast_true(v->value);
02537 #if defined(HAVE_SYSINFO)
02538       } else if (!strcasecmp(v->name, "minmemfree")) {
02539          /* specify the minimum amount of free memory to retain.  Asterisk should stop accepting new calls
02540           * if the amount of free memory falls below this watermark */
02541          if ((sscanf(v->value, "%ld", &option_minmemfree) != 1) || (option_minmemfree < 0)) {
02542             option_minmemfree = 0;
02543          }
02544 #endif
02545       }
02546    }
02547    ast_config_destroy(cfg);
02548 }
02549 
02550 static void *monitor_sig_flags(void *unused)
02551 {
02552    for (;;) {
02553       struct pollfd p = { sig_alert_pipe[0], POLLIN, 0 };
02554       int a;
02555       poll(&p, 1, -1);
02556       if (sig_flags.need_reload) {
02557          sig_flags.need_reload = 0;
02558          ast_module_reload(NULL);
02559       }
02560       if (sig_flags.need_quit) {
02561          sig_flags.need_quit = 0;
02562          quit_handler(0, 0, 1, 0);
02563       }
02564       read(sig_alert_pipe[0], &a, sizeof(a));
02565    }
02566 
02567    return NULL;
02568 }
02569 
02570 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
02571 {
02572    int c;
02573    char filename[80] = "";
02574    char hostname[MAXHOSTNAMELEN] = "";
02575    char tmp[80];
02576    char * xarg = NULL;
02577    int x;
02578    FILE *f;
02579    sigset_t sigs;
02580    int num;
02581    int is_child_of_nonroot = 0;
02582    char *buf;
02583    char *runuser = NULL, *rungroup = NULL;
02584 
02585    /* Remember original args for restart */
02586    if (argc > sizeof(_argv) / sizeof(_argv[0]) - 1) {
02587       fprintf(stderr, "Truncating argument size to %d\n", (int)(sizeof(_argv) / sizeof(_argv[0])) - 1);
02588       argc = sizeof(_argv) / sizeof(_argv[0]) - 1;
02589    }
02590    for (x=0; x<argc; x++)
02591       _argv[x] = argv[x];
02592    _argv[x] = NULL;
02593 
02594    /* if the progname is rasterisk consider it a remote console */
02595    if (argv[0] && (strstr(argv[0], "rasterisk")) != NULL) {
02596       ast_set_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_NO_FORK | AST_OPT_FLAG_REMOTE);
02597    }
02598    if (gethostname(hostname, sizeof(hostname)-1))
02599       ast_copy_string(hostname, "<Unknown>", sizeof(hostname));
02600    ast_mainpid = getpid();
02601    ast_ulaw_init();
02602    ast_alaw_init();
02603    callerid_init();
02604    ast_builtins_init();
02605    ast_event_init();
02606    ast_utils_init();
02607    tdd_init();
02608    /* When Asterisk restarts after it has dropped the root privileges,
02609     * it can't issue setuid(), setgid(), setgroups() or set_priority() 
02610     */
02611    if (getenv("ASTERISK_ALREADY_NONROOT"))
02612       is_child_of_nonroot=1;
02613    if (getenv("HOME")) 
02614       snprintf(filename, sizeof(filename), "%s/.asterisk_history", getenv("HOME"));
02615    /* Check for options */
02616    while ((c = getopt(argc, argv, "mtThfFdvVqprRgciInx:U:G:C:L:M:e:")) != -1) {
02617       switch (c) {
02618 #if defined(HAVE_SYSINFO)
02619       case 'e':
02620          if ((sscanf(&optarg[1], "%ld", &option_minmemfree) != 1) || (option_minmemfree < 0)) {
02621             option_minmemfree = 0;
02622          }
02623          break;
02624 #endif
02625 #if HAVE_WORKING_FORK
02626       case 'F':
02627          ast_set_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_ALWAYS_FORK);
02628          break;
02629       case 'f':
02630          ast_set_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_NO_FORK);
02631          break;
02632 #endif
02633       case 'd':
02634          option_debug++;
02635          ast_set_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_NO_FORK);
02636          break;
02637       case 'c':
02638          ast_set_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_NO_FORK | AST_OPT_FLAG_CONSOLE);
02639          break;
02640       case 'n':
02641          ast_set_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_NO_COLOR);
02642          break;
02643       case 'r':
02644          ast_set_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_NO_FORK | AST_OPT_FLAG_REMOTE);
02645          break;
02646       case 'R':
02647          ast_set_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_NO_FORK | AST_OPT_FLAG_REMOTE | AST_OPT_FLAG_RECONNECT);
02648          break;
02649       case 'p':
02650          ast_set_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_HIGH_PRIORITY);
02651          break;
02652       case 'v':
02653          option_verbose++;
02654          ast_set_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_NO_FORK);
02655          break;
02656       case 'm':
02657          ast_set_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_MUTE);
02658          break;
02659       case 'M':
02660          if ((sscanf(optarg, "%d", &option_maxcalls) != 1) || (option_maxcalls < 0))
02661             option_maxcalls = 0;
02662          break;
02663       case 'L':
02664          if ((sscanf(optarg, "%lf", &option_maxload) != 1) || (option_maxload < 0.0))
02665             option_maxload = 0.0;
02666          break;
02667       case 'q':
02668          ast_set_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_QUIET);
02669          break;
02670       case 't':
02671          ast_set_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_CACHE_RECORD_FILES);
02672          break;
02673       case 'T':
02674          ast_set_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_TIMESTAMP);
02675          break;
02676       case 'x':
02677          ast_set_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_EXEC);
02678          xarg = optarg;
02679          break;
02680       case 'C':
02681          ast_copy_string(ast_config_AST_CONFIG_FILE, optarg, sizeof(ast_config_AST_CONFIG_FILE));
02682          ast_set_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_OVERRIDE_CONFIG);
02683          break;
02684       case 'I':
02685          ast_set_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_INTERNAL_TIMING);
02686          break;
02687       case 'i':
02688          ast_set_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_INIT_KEYS);
02689          break;
02690       case 'g':
02691          ast_set_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_DUMP_CORE);
02692          break;
02693       case 'h':
02694          show_cli_help();
02695          exit(0);
02696       case 'V':
02697          show_version();
02698          exit(0);
02699       case 'U':
02700          runuser = optarg;
02701          break;
02702       case 'G':
02703          rungroup = optarg;
02704          break;
02705       case '?':
02706          exit(1);
02707       }
02708    }
02709 
02710    if (ast_opt_console || option_verbose || (ast_opt_remote && !ast_opt_exec)) {
02711       ast_register_verbose(console_verboser);
02712       WELCOME_MESSAGE;
02713    }
02714 
02715    if (ast_opt_console && !option_verbose) 
02716       ast_verbose("[ Booting...\n");
02717 
02718    if (ast_opt_always_fork && (ast_opt_remote || ast_opt_console)) {
02719       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "'alwaysfork' is not compatible with console or remote console mode; ignored\n");
02720       ast_clear_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_ALWAYS_FORK);
02721    }
02722 
02723    /* For remote connections, change the name of the remote connection.
02724     * We do this for the benefit of init scripts (which need to know if/when
02725     * the main asterisk process has died yet). */
02726    if (ast_opt_remote) {
02727       strcpy(argv[0], "rasterisk");
02728       for (x = 1; x < argc; x++) {
02729          argv[x] = argv[0] + 10;
02730       }
02731    }
02732 
02733    if (ast_opt_console && !option_verbose) 
02734       ast_verbose("[ Reading Master Configuration ]\n");
02735    ast_readconfig();
02736 
02737    if (!ast_language_is_prefix && !ast_opt_remote)
02738       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "The 'languageprefix' option in asterisk.conf is deprecated; in a future release it will be removed, and your sound files will need to be organized in the 'new style' language layout.\n");
02739 
02740    if (ast_opt_dump_core) {
02741       struct rlimit l;
02742       memset(&l, 0, sizeof(l));
02743       l.rlim_cur = RLIM_INFINITY;
02744       l.rlim_max = RLIM_INFINITY;
02745       if (setrlimit(RLIMIT_CORE, &l)) {
02746          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to disable core size resource limit: %s\n", strerror(errno));
02747       }
02748    }
02749 
02750    if ((!rungroup) && !ast_strlen_zero(ast_config_AST_RUN_GROUP))
02751       rungroup = ast_config_AST_RUN_GROUP;
02752    if ((!runuser) && !ast_strlen_zero(ast_config_AST_RUN_USER))
02753       runuser = ast_config_AST_RUN_USER;
02754 
02755 #ifndef __CYGWIN__
02756 
02757    if (!is_child_of_nonroot) 
02758       ast_set_priority(ast_opt_high_priority);
02759 
02760    if (!is_child_of_nonroot && rungroup) {
02761       struct group *gr;
02762       gr = getgrnam(rungroup);
02763       if (!gr) {
02764          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "No such group '%s'!\n", rungroup);
02765          exit(1);
02766       }
02767       if (setgid(gr->gr_gid)) {
02768          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to setgid to %d (%s)\n", (int)gr->gr_gid, rungroup);
02769          exit(1);
02770       }
02771       if (setgroups(0, NULL)) {
02772          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to drop unneeded groups\n");
02773          exit(1);
02774       }
02775       if (option_verbose)
02776          ast_verbose("Running as group '%s'\n", rungroup);
02777    }
02778 
02779    if (!is_child_of_nonroot && runuser) {
02780 #ifdef HAVE_CAP
02781       int has_cap = 1;
02782 #endif /* HAVE_CAP */
02783       struct passwd *pw;
02784       pw = getpwnam(runuser);
02785       if (!pw) {
02786          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "No such user '%s'!\n", runuser);
02787          exit(1);
02788       }
02789 #ifdef HAVE_CAP
02790       if (prctl(PR_SET_KEEPCAPS, 1, 0, 0, 0)) {
02791          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to keep capabilities.\n");
02792          has_cap = 0;
02793       }
02794 #endif /* HAVE_CAP */
02795       if (!rungroup) {
02796          if (setgid(pw->pw_gid)) {
02797             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to setgid to %d!\n", (int)pw->pw_gid);
02798             exit(1);
02799          }
02800          if (initgroups(pw->pw_name, pw->pw_gid)) {
02801             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to init groups for '%s'\n", runuser);
02802             exit(1);
02803          }
02804       }
02805       if (setuid(pw->pw_uid)) {
02806          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to setuid to %d (%s)\n", (int)pw->pw_uid, runuser);
02807          exit(1);
02808       }
02809       setenv("ASTERISK_ALREADY_NONROOT", "yes", 1);
02810       if (option_verbose)
02811          ast_verbose("Running as user '%s'\n", runuser);
02812 #ifdef HAVE_CAP
02813       if (has_cap) {
02814          cap_t cap;
02815 
02816          cap = cap_from_text("cap_net_admin=ep");
02817 
02818          if (cap_set_proc(cap))
02819             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to install capabilities.\n");
02820 
02821          if (cap_free(cap))
02822             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to drop capabilities.\n");
02823       }
02824 #endif /* HAVE_CAP */
02825    }
02826 
02827 #endif /* __CYGWIN__ */
02828 
02829 #ifdef linux
02830    if (geteuid() && ast_opt_dump_core) {
02831       if (prctl(PR_SET_DUMPABLE, 1, 0, 0, 0) < 0) {
02832          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to set the process for core dumps after changing to a non-root user. %s\n", strerror(errno));
02833       }  
02834    }
02835 #endif
02836 
02837    ast_term_init();
02838    printf(term_end());
02839    fflush(stdout);
02840 
02841    if (ast_opt_console && !option_verbose) 
02842       ast_verbose("[ Initializing Custom Configuration Options ]\n");
02843    /* custom config setup */
02844    register_config_cli();
02845    read_config_maps();
02846    
02847    if (ast_opt_console) {
02848       if (el_hist == NULL || el == NULL)
02849          ast_el_initialize();
02850 
02851       if (!ast_strlen_zero(filename))
02852          ast_el_read_history(filename);
02853    }
02854 
02855    if (ast_tryconnect()) {
02856       /* One is already running */
02857       if (ast_opt_remote) {
02858          if (ast_opt_exec) {
02859             ast_remotecontrol(xarg);
02860             quit_handler(0, 0, 0, 0);
02861             exit(0);
02862          }
02863          printf(term_quit());
02864          ast_remotecontrol(NULL);
02865          quit_handler(0, 0, 0, 0);
02866          exit(0);
02867       } else {
02868          ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Asterisk already running on %s.  Use 'asterisk -r' to connect.\n", ast_config_AST_SOCKET);
02869          printf(term_quit());
02870          exit(1);
02871       }
02872    } else if (ast_opt_remote || ast_opt_exec) {
02873       ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Unable to connect to remote asterisk (does %s exist?)\n", ast_config_AST_SOCKET);
02874       printf(term_quit());
02875       exit(1);
02876    }
02877    /* Blindly write pid file since we couldn't connect */
02878    unlink(ast_config_AST_PID);
02879    f = fopen(ast_config_AST_PID, "w");
02880    if (f) {
02881       fprintf(f, "%ld\n", (long)getpid());
02882       fclose(f);
02883    } else
02884       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to open pid file '%s': %s\n", ast_config_AST_PID, strerror(errno));
02885 
02886 #if HAVE_WORKING_FORK
02887    if (ast_opt_always_fork || !ast_opt_no_fork) {
02888       daemon(0, 0);
02889       ast_mainpid = getpid();
02890       /* Blindly re-write pid file since we are forking */
02891       unlink(ast_config_AST_PID);
02892       f = fopen(ast_config_AST_PID, "w");
02893       if (f) {
02894          fprintf(f, "%ld\n", (long)ast_mainpid);
02895          fclose(f);
02896       } else
02897          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to open pid file '%s': %s\n", ast_config_AST_PID, strerror(errno));
02898    }
02899 #endif
02900 
02901    /* Test recursive mutex locking. */
02902    if (test_for_thread_safety())
02903       ast_verbose("Warning! Asterisk is not thread safe.\n");
02904 
02905    ast_makesocket();
02906    sigemptyset(&sigs);
02907    sigaddset(&sigs, SIGHUP);
02908    sigaddset(&sigs, SIGTERM);
02909    sigaddset(&sigs, SIGINT);
02910    sigaddset(&sigs, SIGPIPE);
02911    sigaddset(&sigs, SIGWINCH);
02912    pthread_sigmask(SIG_BLOCK, &sigs, NULL);
02913    signal(SIGURG, urg_handler);
02914    signal(SIGINT, __quit_handler);
02915    signal(SIGTERM, __quit_handler);
02916    signal(SIGHUP, hup_handler);
02917    signal(SIGCHLD, child_handler);
02918    signal(SIGPIPE, SIG_IGN);
02919 
02920    /* ensure that the random number generators are seeded with a different value every time
02921       Asterisk is started
02922    */
02923    srand((unsigned int) getpid() + (unsigned int) time(NULL));
02924    initstate((unsigned int) getpid() * 65536 + (unsigned int) time(NULL), randompool, sizeof(randompool));
02925 
02926    if (init_logger()) {    /* Start logging subsystem */
02927       printf(term_quit());
02928       exit(1);
02929    }
02930 
02931    threadstorage_init();
02932 
02933    if (load_modules(1)) {     /* Load modules */
02934       printf(term_quit());
02935       exit(1);
02936    }
02937 
02938    if (dnsmgr_init()) {    /* Initialize the DNS manager */
02939       printf(term_quit());
02940       exit(1);
02941    }
02942 
02943    ast_http_init();     /* Start the HTTP server, if needed */
02944 
02945    ast_channels_init();
02946 
02947    if (init_manager()) {
02948       printf(term_quit());
02949       exit(1);
02950    }
02951 
02952    if (ast_cdr_engine_init()) {
02953       printf(term_quit());
02954       exit(1);
02955    }
02956 
02957    if (ast_device_state_engine_init()) {
02958       printf(term_quit());
02959       exit(1);
02960    }
02961 
02962    ast_rtp_init();
02963 
02964    ast_udptl_init();
02965 
02966    if (ast_image_init()) {
02967       printf(term_quit());
02968       exit(1);
02969    }
02970 
02971    if (ast_file_init()) {
02972       printf(term_quit());
02973       exit(1);
02974    }
02975 
02976    if (load_pbx()) {
02977       printf(term_quit());
02978       exit(1);
02979    }
02980 
02981    if (init_framer()) {
02982       printf(term_quit());
02983       exit(1);
02984    }
02985 
02986    if (astdb_init()) {
02987       printf(term_quit());
02988       exit(1);
02989    }
02990 
02991    if (ast_enum_init()) {
02992       printf(term_quit());
02993       exit(1);
02994    }
02995 
02996    if (load_modules(0)) {
02997       printf(term_quit());
02998       exit(1);
02999    }
03000 
03001    dnsmgr_start_refresh();
03002 
03003    /* We might have the option of showing a console, but for now just
03004       do nothing... */
03005    if (ast_opt_console && !option_verbose)
03006       ast_verbose(" ]\n");
03007    if (option_verbose || ast_opt_console)
03008       ast_verbose(term_color(tmp, "Asterisk Ready.\n", COLOR_BRWHITE, COLOR_BLACK, sizeof(tmp)));
03009    if (ast_opt_no_fork)
03010       consolethread = pthread_self();
03011 
03012    if (pipe(sig_alert_pipe))
03013       sig_alert_pipe[0] = sig_alert_pipe[1] = -1;
03014 
03015    ast_set_flag(&ast_options, AST_OPT_FLAG_FULLY_BOOTED);
03016    pthread_sigmask(SIG_UNBLOCK, &sigs, NULL);
03017 
03018 #ifdef __AST_DEBUG_MALLOC
03019    __ast_mm_init();
03020 #endif   
03021 
03022    time(&ast_startuptime);
03023    ast_cli_register_multiple(cli_asterisk, sizeof(cli_asterisk) / sizeof(struct ast_cli_entry));
03024 
03025    if (ast_opt_console) {
03026       /* Console stuff now... */
03027       /* Register our quit function */
03028       char title[256];
03029       pthread_t dont_care;
03030 
03031       ast_pthread_create_detached(&dont_care, NULL, monitor_sig_flags, NULL);
03032 
03033       set_icon("Asterisk");
03034       snprintf(title, sizeof(title), "Asterisk Console on '%s' (pid %ld)", hostname, (long)ast_mainpid);
03035       set_title(title);
03036 
03037       for (;;) {
03038          buf = (char *)el_gets(el, &num);
03039          if (buf) {
03040             if (buf[strlen(buf)-1] == '\n')
03041                buf[strlen(buf)-1] = '\0';
03042 
03043             consolehandler((char *)buf);
03044          } else if (ast_opt_remote && (write(STDOUT_FILENO, "\nUse EXIT or QUIT to exit the asterisk console\n",
03045                strlen("\nUse EXIT or QUIT to exit the asterisk console\n")) < 0)) {
03046             /* Whoa, stdout disappeared from under us... Make /dev/null's */
03047             int fd;
03048             fd = open("/dev/null", O_RDWR);
03049             if (fd > -1) {
03050                dup2(fd, STDOUT_FILENO);
03051                dup2(fd, STDIN_FILENO);
03052             } else
03053                ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Failed to open /dev/null to recover from dead console. Bad things will happen!\n");
03054             break;
03055          }
03056       }
03057    }
03058 
03059    monitor_sig_flags(NULL);
03060 
03061    return 0;
03062 }
